thread.title: Jill Stein’s Failed Recount Winds Up In Quite The Payday
thread.title_full: Jill Stein’s Failed Recount Winds Up In Quite The Payday

author: John Falkenberg
title: Jill Stein’s Failed Recount Winds Up In Quite The Payday
text:
Indiana Bill Protects Student Prayer in School 
As we all remember, the recount effort in Wisconsin resulted in very little change, and the Pennsylvania and Michigan recount efforts were eventually dropped. 
The Washington Free Beacon reported that Stein will receive $2,000,000 in reimbursements after initial estimates “were well above the final costs of the failed presidential recount attempts in three battleground states.” 
Stein, of course, claimed not to be satisfied with the Wisconsin recount, saying that the money spent yielded “half” a recount.   
“When we asked for a full recount we only got a hand recount in about half of the precincts, for about half of the voters,” she said according to WPR . “So essentially what we got was half a recount.” 
For crying out loud, Jill. 
The Washington Free Beacon also reported that “Stein, whose team did not return numerous requests for comment, announced that the remaining funds go towards her continued “fight for election integrity.” 
Congratulations liberals — you were bamboozled. Again.
